docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna Inc, the third largest U.S. health insurer, is exploring a sale of some of Coventry Health Care Inc's assets worth as much as $1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, a year after it acquired its rival for $5.6 billion.

headline.main: Exclusive: Aetna Mulls Sale of Coventry Health Care Assets-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Aetna Mulls Sale of Coventry Health Care Assets-Sources

docs.snippet: Aetna Inc, the third largest U.S. health insurer, is exploring a sale of some of Coventry Health Care Inc's assets worth as much as $1.5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, a year after it acquired its rival for $5.6 billion.

docs.lead_paragraph: 3-D mammograms may be better at finding cancer than regular scans, a large study suggests, although whether that means saving more lives isn't known.

headline.main: 3-D Mammogram Scans May Find More Breast Cancer
headline.print_headline: 3-D Mammogram Scans May Find More Breast Cancer

docs.snippet: 3-D mammograms may be better at finding cancer than regular scans, a large study suggests, although whether that means saving more lives isn't known.

docs.lead_paragraph: Montana officials said Tuesday they are notifying 1.3 million people that their personal information could have been accessed by hackers who broke into a state health department computer server.

headline.main: Montana to Notify 1.3 Million of Computer Hacking

docs.snippet: Montana officials said Tuesday they are notifying 1.3 million people that their personal information could have been accessed by hackers who broke into a state health department computer server.

docs.lead_paragraph: When the government updates its estimate Wednesday of how the U.S. economy fared last quarter, the number is pretty sure to be ugly. Horrible even.

docs.lead_paragraph: What are the best and worst places to stay healthy as you age? For answers, take out a map and follow the Mississippi River from north to south. The healthiest people over 65 are in Minnesota, the sickest in Mississippi.

headline.main: The State of Senior Health: It Depends on Your State
headline.print_headline: The State of Senior Health: It Depends on Your State

docs.snippet: What are the best and worst places to stay healthy as you age? For answers, take out a map and follow the Mississippi River from north to south. The healthiest people over 65 are in Minnesota, the sickest in Mississippi.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe announced a slew of measures Tuesday aimed at restoring Japan's global competitiveness. Past governments have sought and failed to enact many of the reforms Abe and other leaders say are needed to revamp an outdated post-World War II industrial model and sustain growth for decades to come.

headline.main: Abe's Grand Plan to Revive Japan's Economic Might
headline.print_headline: Abe's Grand Plan to Revive Japan's Economic Might

docs.lead_paragraph: India is likely to raise the number of drugs deemed essential and therefore subject to price caps to improve affordability, said people directly involved in the process.

docs.lead_paragraph: Besides an upward tick in spending by people who delayed treatment, the report, by PricewaterhouseCoopers’s Health Research Institute, forecasts a cost growth of 6.8 percent.

headline.main: Consumers Will Spend More on Health Care in 2015, Report Predicts

docs.snippet: Besides an upward tick in spending by people who delayed treatment, the report, by PricewaterhouseCoopers’s Health Research Institute, forecasts a cost growth of 6.8 percent.
